Description: Lending Income Base: A temporary variable that sums all assets on which the bank earns its main lending rate (r). This includes all firm loans (L_i) and any overdrafts from firms (-D_i) or households (-D_h).

Base Rate Cost/Income Base: A temporary variable that sums all assets and liabilities tied to the central bank's base rate (r_bar), capturing the net cost of holding deposits and income from reserves.

Change in Equity (Retained Earnings): Represents the portion of the bank's profits (Pi_k) that is kept as retained earnings after paying taxes and dividends. This value is immediately added to the bank's state variable E_k.
